sentences.sContent: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight (= after midnight ) !
sentences.sCn: 你现在不能打电话给她，都过午夜了！

sentences.sContent: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight (= after midnight ) .
sentences.sCn: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

sentences.sContent: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
It is totally out of the question to postpone the midnight deadline.
sentences.sCn: 延迟午夜的最后期限是根本不可能的。

phrases.pCn: n. 夜半太阳（夏季在南极或北极能见到）

trans.tranOther: Midnight is used to describe something that happens or appears at midnight or in the middle of the night
